Text.Value: I'm a guard from a nearby village. I'm here to offer my assistance.
Those tracks lead to Moonrise Towers.
I can tell you: Grand Duke Ravengard was kidnapped.
No luck. Sorry.
You're no help just standing there. Help us!

EditorData.NodeContext: <Standing.> Scooping water and throwing it on the fire.
EditorData.SFXTags: Water being thrown from a wooden bucket

Text.Value: Hey, HEY! Stop! You're destroying evidence!

EditorData.AnimationTags: PC casually swipes their foot on the ground, like they're wiping something up with it. <KrisB>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: PC swipes their foot on the ground, like they're wiping something up with it.
EditorData.SFXTags: Wiping the stone floor with the PC's foot
EditorData.VFXTags: Dust from wiping the stone floor with the player's foot, and obscuring the footprints.

Text.Value: Leave.
Go away. It's hard enough reading these tracks without you stomping all over.
I'm trying to find out where they took the - what they came for.
Drow and goblins raided the inn and burned it to the ground.
There's no need for any of that. Come on, stand up.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Player bows like a paladin, swearing to help her (Needs start, idle, end) <KrisB>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Flaming Fist, exasperated, pulls them back to their feet.

Text.Value: Most of the tracks were destroyed by the flames.
I'll see if I can spot anything.
You're in my way. Get moving.
Spot anything?
You, a guard? Huh. Have to admit, you are more than a little... threatening.
Leave. That's an order.
Can't you see the inn is burning?!  Help or get out of the way!

EditorData.NodeContext: <Standing,> Trying to put out the fire

Text.Value: I can tell you: the Grand Duke was taken to Moonrise Towers.
*You notice the tell-tale clumsiness of goblins, alongside something more light-footed - drow.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KRIS] Player kneels down to inspect the footprints closely (Need start, idle & end)
EditorData.VFXTags: Visible footprints of clumsy goblins and lightfooted drow

Text.Value: What'd I tell you? It's a godsdamned mess.

EditorData.AnimationTags: *DUPE* [KRIS] PC stands ups (End of Footprint Inspection)

Text.Value: And if they took him down there... Helm save him.
Tracking is what I do. Let me see if I can spot anything.
Ignore her - keep wiping away the tracks.
Any idea where they took the Grand Duke?
By all means. Doubt you'll have much luck though.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: rerecord notes. She should be standing for whole line.<greg>

Text.Value: What does it look like? I'm trying to sort out what happened here.
We still have no idea where they took the - what they came for.
And torched the place while they were at it.
What in the Nine Hells is wrong with you?

EditorData.NodeContext: <Standing> An outburst, but she catches herself and takes a deep breath.

Text.Value: I don't have the Fists to take on a Zhentarim base. We're stretched thin as it is.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: reshoot note:  Actor appears to have had a cold for this line only, doesn't match the VO of other lines. <Greg>

Text.Value: What in the Nine Hells did I just tell you?!

EditorData.AnimationTags: *DUBE* PC casually swipes their foot on the ground, like they're wiping something up with it. <KrisB>
EditorData.SFXTags: Wiping the stone floor with the PC's foot
EditorData.VFXTags: Dust from wiping the stone floor with the player's foot, and obscuring the footprints.

Text.Value: There were drow here, so my best guess would be the Underdark.
By my oath, you have my help. But I must to know the truth to assist you.
Just stay out of their way and hope they stay out of yours.
Right. And I suppose you saw the smoke from the Underdark?
The tracks converge here. Two, maybe three drow. At least one of ours.
Wipe away the tracks with your foot.
Oh, damn it all. Half the Sword Coast probably knows by now.
There aren't any villages within a day's walk.
Be easier if you weren't bothering me.

EditorData.AnimationTags: *DUPE* [KRIS] PC stands ups (End of Footprint Inspection)

Text.Value: You're the one who seems confused.
The raiders kidnapped Grand Duke Ravengard of Baldur's Gate. Killed his entire guard while they were at it.
Your kind burned the inn to the ground. Even brought goblins along for the fun.
My true kin have no care for surface raids. You can trust me.
Evidence for what? Surely you've pieced something together by now.
These tracks should be able to tell us everything that happened here.
Right. I don't think you hail from anywhere close by.
And you should just bugger off.

EditorData.NodeContext: <Standing.> She says this line EXTREMELY sarcastically.

Text.Value: Hm. You haven't tried to slit my throat yet...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: rer ecord notes. She was Recorded as kneeling, she should be standing <Greg>

Text.Value: *Your gaze follows the drow footprints around the courtyard and south - out of the inn.*
Leave.
The drow went south.
What do you think you're doing? Stop that!
I'll pass it up the chain of command - whatever good it'll do for the Grand Duke.

EditorData.NodeContext: <Standing> Shaking her head. This news has her spooked.

Text.Value: How do you - oh, never mind. Half the Sword Coast probably knows by now.
But I can't piece together much, thanks to the fire.
I'll blame that trick on simple curiosity. This time.
And? What do you expect me to do about it?
You, a guard? Gods, they must be desperate if they're hiring Underdark muscle.
Can't really tell the difference between you lot, honestly.
We'll stay put for now. Still might get something out of these tracks.
You're smart to keep quiet. Nobles attract the wrong sort of attention.
Have you figured anything out?
Huh. Don't know how much help you can be, really.
Oh, stand up. You're embarrassing yourself.

EditorData.AnimationTags: *DUPE* Player bows like a paladin, swearing to help her (Needs start, idle, end) <KrisB>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Flaming Fist, exasperated, pulls them back to their feet.

Text.Value: *The tracks are a chaotic mess. Gleaning any information from them is impossible.*
Leave.
We should've sent another dozen guards, at least. He's not just any noble, damn it!
I found a pack of Zhentarim hiding nearby.
How did you...
You might as well give up.
Watch where you step - these tracks might tell us where the raiders went.
I'll blame your little lie on simple curiosity. This time.

EditorData.NodeContext: <Standing> Emphasis on 'simple' - she's calling the player stupid.

Text.Value: I can tell you: the inn was raided by goblins and drow.
That's something. But they could've gone south and then down - towards the Underdark.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KRIS] PC stands ups (End of Footprint Inspection)

Text.Value: You should get going. And watch for goblins on the road.
If they allied with goblins, they were not Lolth's Chosen. Tell me more - now.
Clearly you're in a rough spot. I can help.
I appreciate the offer, but you'd just get in the way.
The old fortress? Gods, that whole area is cursed.
The drow came for the Duke. Killed near everyone in the inn while they were at it.
What are you doing?
They took the Grand Duke to Moonrise Towers.
Leave.
It's a shame they left any survivors. That's poor form.
You need to go. Now.
From here they went... Damn! It's all so confused.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dain goes from kneeling to standing on "It's all so confused" - looking at the tracks on the ground in confusion

Text.Value: Maybe you need a second pair of eyes. Want me to take a look?
Figure it out for yourself.
Search her mind for information.
The Counsellor died, too. This has all gone to the hells.
Nothing I didn't already know.
At least his counsellor survived, thank the gods.
I'm not confused, I'm frustrated.
Leave, before I put a sword through you.

EditorData.NodeContext: <Standing> Through gritted teeth - she's trying desperately to remain calm

Synopsis: A Flaming Fist initially trying to put out the fires at Waukeen's Rest, an inn that was attacked by goblins and drow in the night. If the other Flaming Fists find a way inside, she stops to watch. After Desire escapes and the inn is burnt down, she investigates the area, kneeling and inspecting tracks.
